@jasonkuster  Sorry for point it out. I don't have write access right to "gs://dataflow-samples/", can you give me the authentication or help me upload the file?

Thanks Ken. PTAL.
R: @dhalperi

`DataflowRunner` has some overrides for streaming side inputs that need `RequiresWindowAccess` but cannot be ported immediately because they use `windowingInternals().writePCollectionViewData`. I'll re-open after sorting that out.
Still unclear what the snappy issue is. The error itself is very common, but does not seem to be what is affecting this PR. Holding off for now.
This actually looks like a Jenkins race condition or some such. The errors in that build are not part of this PR. Rebasing to kick...
I'll close this for now.

@aaltay, after merging `python-sdk` from upstream, we still have the same issue in this branch:

```
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.codehaus.mojo:exec-maven-plugin:1.4.0:java (beam-exec-java) on project beam-runners-flink_2.10-examples: The parameters 'mainClass' for goal org.codehaus.mojo:exec-maven-plugin:1.4.0:java are missing or invalid -> [Help 1]
org.apache.maven.lifecycle.LifecycleExecutionException: Failed to execute goal org.codehaus.mojo:exec-maven-plugin:1.4.0:java (beam-exec-java) on project beam-runners-flink_2.10-examples: The parameters 'mainClass' for goal org.codehaus.mojo:exec-maven-plugin:1.4.0:java are missing or invalid
```

I've tried to get rid of the `java` goal in `beam-runners-flink_2.10-examples` with the same trick I'm using in `beam-sdks-python`, but it does not work... Maybe we could involve the guys from #724 (@mxm) to figure out what's the lateral issue here.
I'm rebasing to test the Apex runner.

@dhalperi - I've addressed your comments. Please, take a look now.
I've create appropriate issue in JIRA for Kinesis IT tests once this is merged.
Rebased and first implementation of the `getEstimatedSizeBytes()` and `splitIntoBundles()` methods.
R: @lukecwik

R: @lukecwik

- Solve the merge conflicts.
LGTM, will merge once jenkins/travis runs finish

Test failure:
org.apache.beam.sdk.io.WriteTest.testWriteUnbounded

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: unable to serialize org.apache.beam.sdk.transforms.DoFnReflector$SimpleDoFnAdapter@34518f0
    at org.apache.beam.sdk.util.SerializableUtils.serializeToByteArray(SerializableUtils.java:56)
    at org.apache.beam.sdk.util.SerializableUtils.clone(SerializableUtils.java:93)
    at org.apache.beam.sdk.transforms.ParDo$Bound.<init>(ParDo.java:672)
    at org.apache.beam.sdk.transforms.ParDo$Unbound.of(ParDo.java:630)

`Caused by: java.io.NotSerializableException: org.apache.beam.sdk.io.WriteTest`

The enclosing class needs to be `Serializable` if you're using anonymous `DoFn`s.
LGTM

@wikier

I got both python-sdk and flink examples running locally. See this commit: https://github.com/aaltay/incubator-beam/commit/a1df1f57f14261edf34c5ae2efa3f88d7b8a8225

It is based on yours. Except that I used <pluginManagement> to disable execution. I noticed the flink was using this too. And adding an id there broke their disable mechanism. With this both places can use the same way of disabling.

(In this commit I changed 1 place related to maven version to run locally with my old maven installation. That part should not be submitted.)

Could you try this please?

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/6113891/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/6113891)

Changes Unknown when pulling **2efe7617a595b8ac6167db40724d9874afd6df23 on francesperry:master** into *\* on apache:master**.
I commented on the RAT issue as well. Hopefully applying both will pass all the tests. Fingers crossed. @wikier Thank you again.

R: -@bjchambers I had added you since you were very in-the-loop on both the new `DoFn` and display data, but now this PR has nothing to do with those and I've sent more than enough your way.

R: @aljoscha care to take a look? The tests have been passing for a while, but with some Travis timeouts. I just rebased to force Travis to run again in its new, faster, configuration.

R: @jbonofre you might also have some opinion about the best way to deal with this. Now that Travis is caching, it is less of an issue. But it still makes sense to time out in a couple seconds rather than multiple minutes, to allow retry to be effective.
Will follow your suggestion in a new PR, just hard resetting this.

Changes Unknown when pulling **2efe7617a595b8ac6167db40724d9874afd6df23 on francesperry:master** into *\* on apache:master**.

Cool, @aaltay! That trick works better, actually avoiding inheritance in `exec-maven-plugin` executions previously configure.

Also reverted `nose` to `setup_requires`, and properly configured RAT exclusion.

So now the CI system should be, finally, happy :smile: 

Thanks so much for your time with these last details. I hope the overall idea of this PR would be useful for the podling.
@jbonofre @kennknowles @dhalperi rebased on recent master. Not sure what is going wrong with the travis test
@aaltay I've patch the RAT configuration, but Jenkins reports unknown licenses I'm not able to reproduce locally...
R: @kennknowles and @jbonofre

I spared a Jira ticket since it's a very small change, hope it's ok.

R: @kennknowles

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/6125519/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/6125519)

Changes Unknown when pulling **2efe7617a595b8ac6167db40724d9874afd6df23 on francesperry:master** into *\* on apache:master**.

We had left `SerializableMatcher` and `SerializableMatchers` package-private to avoid diamond-dependency issues.

Since 2b63fb9 made `SerializableMatcher` public, this change has no additional negative impact. The two classes are really just a Java-ism.

LGTM based on precedent, but it is probably still worth considering what the impact on users is. Since hamcrest is already a `provided` dependency, even before 2b63fb9, the impact is on users who want to use this or anything that uses it transitively.

R: @dhalperi for this.
